title: Creates a domestic abuse hotline for teens
summary: Creates a domestic abuse hotline for teens; requires all high schools within the state to conduct an assembly on domestic abuse.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          284

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. ORTIZ, PEOPLES-STOKES, AUBRY, TITONE -- Multi-
         Sponsored by -- M. of A.  CLARK, COLTON, HOOPER, MAYERSOHN,  ROBINSON,
         WEISENBERG, WRIGHT -- read once and referred to the Committee on Chil-
         dren and Families

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  social  services law, in relation to creating a
         domestic abuse hotline for teens; and to amend the education  law,  in
         relation to requiring a school assembly on domestic abuse

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  Section 459-h of the social services law, as renumbered by
    2  chapter 428 of the laws of 2009, is renumbered section 459-i and  a  new
    3  section 459-h is added to read as follows:
    4    S  459-H.  DOMESTIC  ABUSE  HOTLINE FOR TEENS. THE COMMISSIONER OF THE
    5  OFFICE OF CHILDREN AND FAMILY SERVICES  SHALL  ESTABLISH  A  TWENTY-FOUR
    6  HOUR  DOMESTIC ABUSE HOTLINE FOR TEENS. THE HOTLINE SHALL BE A TOLL-FREE
    7  NUMBER. THE LOCAL SOCIAL SERVICES DISTRICT SHALL TAKE REASONABLE EFFORTS
    8  TO INFORM TEENS LIVING IN THEIR DISTRICT  OF  THE  AVAILABILITY  OF  THE
    9  HOTLINE.
   10    S  2.  Section 3234 of the education law, as renumbered by chapter 975
   11  of the laws of 1966, is renumbered section 3235 and a new  section  3234
   12  is added to read as follows:
   13    S  3234.  MANDATORY  DOMESTIC ABUSE ASSEMBLY. EVERY HIGH SCHOOL WITHIN
   14  THIS STATE SHALL ANNUALLY CONDUCT AN ASSEMBLY ON THE DANGERS OF DOMESTIC
   15  ABUSE. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ESTABLISH THE GUIDELINES AND  CONTENT  FOR
   16  THE  ASSEMBLY.  THE  ASSEMBLY  SHALL  ALSO  SUPPLY THE STUDENTS WITH THE
   17  TOLL-FREE NUMBER FOR THE DOMESTIC ABUSE HOTLINE FOR TEENS.
   18    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately; provided,  however,  that
   19  section  two  of  this  act shall apply to any school year commencing at
   20  least 30 days after such effective date.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01543-01-1
